alert.note: Alert for Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 7:38PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Surry County through 815 PM EDT... At 735 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms centered near Dobson, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fairview... Dobson... Pilot Mountain... Mountain Park... Pilot Mountain State Park... Level Cross... and Siloam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
